h1: How Many Calories in a Bottle of White Wine?
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle, dry white wine (e.g., Chardonnay or Sauvignon Blanc), ~12% ABV, no added sugars.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, sweetness, brand, alcohol content, and serving size. Check labels or databases for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of dry white wine contains about 615 kcal, mostly from alcohol and carbs.

faqs.q: How many calories in a glass of white wine?
faqs.a: About 82 kcal per 100 ml glass; a standard 150 ml pour is ~123 kcal.

faqs.q: Why are calories high in a bottle of white wine?
faqs.a: Primarily from alcohol (7 kcal/g) at ~12% ABV, plus some carbs.

faqs.q: How does red wine compare to white?
faqs.a: Similar calories (~82 kcal/100 ml), but reds may have slightly more due to skin tannins.

faqs.q: Does bottle size affect calories per bottle?
faqs.a: Calories scale with volume; a 375 ml half-bottle has ~308 kcal.
